sentence.text: The KSHV viral homolog of interleukin-6 gene (epidermal growth factor receptor signaling pathway-6) may play a significant role in tumor development and may serve as a new anti-cancer target, but its role in tumor formation is only partially understood.

entity.text: epidermal growth factor receptor signaling pathway

sentence.text: Here, a novel animal model was used to study how epidermal growth factor receptor signaling pathway-6 affects tumor development.

entity.text: epidermal growth factor receptor signaling pathway

sentence.text: Solid tumors developed and total tumor cell adhesion mediated by integrin and the number of tumors were characterized.

The epidermal growth factor receptor signaling pathway-6 gene had no significant negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II on tumor cell adhesion mediated by integrin, but significantly more tumors were detected when vIL-6 was present.

entity.text: epidermal growth factor receptor signaling pathway
negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Significant differences in expression of B cell markers in cells from extracted tumors were detected based upon the presence of epidermal growth factor receptor signaling pathway-6.

entity.text: epidermal growth factor receptor signaling pathway

sentence.text: B cell markers in tumor cells were also compared to the same cell cardiac muscle tissue development in culture, prior to xenotransplantation; B cell markers were mostly downregulated during tumor formation and these changes did not differ based upon the presence of epidermal growth factor receptor signaling pathway-6.

entity.text: epidermal growth factor receptor signaling pathway

sentence.text: These data indicate that epidermal growth factor receptor signaling pathway-6 plays a role in KSHV tumor formation in B cells in vivo.

entity.text: epidermal growth factor receptor signaling pathway
